content: Tensor Logic is a new programming language proposed by Pedro Domingos, intended to be the fundamental language for artificial intelligence.
Just as physics found its language in calculus and circuit design in Boolean logic, Pedro Domingos argues that Tensor Logic will serve as the missing fundamental language for AI.

Current AI paradigms are split between Deep Learning (good at learning from data, poor at logical reasoning) and Symbolic AI (good at logical reasoning, poor at learning from messy real-world data), and these two do not integrate well.

Tensor Logic unifies Deep Learning and Symbolic AI into a single language, allowing for learning and modification of logical rules, transparent and verifiable reasoning without hallucinations, and the mixing of fuzzy analogical thinking with deduction.
Pedro Domingos claims that trillions of dollars have been wasted on brute-force compute in AI because companies are 'reinventing reasoning' instead of leveraging 40 years of existing AI research.
Predicate Invention is the process by which a system learns to identify 'objects' from raw data, similar to how humans perceive objects rather than just pixels.
